question: What should you do if you do not receive a voter information card before an election?
possible_answers: B. Turn up at your nearest polling station on election day.
C. You should assume you were not chosen to vote.
main_question: What should you do if you do not receive a voter information card before an election?
explanatory_sentence: If you do not receive a voter information card, call your local elections office to ensure that you are on the votersâ€™ list. If you do not have the number, call Elections Canada, in Ottawa, at 1-800-463-6868.
